summary: This is a Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Daily Activity Report for July 22, 2019. It details routine prison operations, security alerts, staffing issues, and inmate counts. The report is significant as it provides a snapshot of the conditions at MCC New York shortly before Jeffrey Epstein's death there in August 2019.

events.title: Anonymous Gang Threat at MCC
events.description: New York City 911 Operator reported to the prison control center an anonymous call indicating the 'Macballers' gang was planning a stabbing in the 11-South housing unit when it opened in the morning.

events.title: Fire Safety Systems Inoperable
events.description: The Fire Alarm and Sprinkler System was reported inoperable, requiring a Fire Watch. Later, the pressure pump system was also reported down, extending the Fire Watch.

events.title: Staffing Shortage Impacts Posts
events.description: Several correctional officer assignments (Phone Monitor, 3 Sally Officer, etc.) were vacated due to a shortage of staff.

keyFacts: The report documents a specific, anonymous threat of gang violence ('Macballers' planning a stabbing) within the MCC on July 22, 2019.
Critical fire safety systems (alarm, sprinkler, pressure pump) were inoperable, placing the institution on a 'Fire Watch'.
The prison was experiencing a staffing shortage severe enough to vacate several correctional officer posts.
The total inmate population at the beginning of the morning shift on July 22, 2019, was 776.
This routine operations report provides context on the security and maintenance environment at MCC New York in the weeks leading up to Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody there in August 2019.
